title: Can I take a family member to court for unpaid loans totaling over $100,000.00
question: I have the checks to prove that a family member borrowed money over the past several years for business and personal reasons and now refuses to pay it back. My husband has now passed and I am on Social Security and really need the monies.
answers:
See a lawyer ASAP to see if your rights to debt collection can be enforced. I offer free consultations.

Best,

Brian Pedigo
www.PedigoLaw.com
If your statute of limitations has been blown, see a debt collection lawyer about strategies to reopen the statute, by getting them to make a payment.
The minimum statute in CA is two years which probably applies to your best theory: money had and received.

Yes you can, better to do it sooner than later because of statute of limitations which could prevent you from collecting if you wait too long.
